The Fish that Climbed Trees: A Journey Through the Eyes of a Curious Creature - This children's book follows the adventures of a fish named Finley who discovers the wonders of the world above the water. Finley, who has always been fascinated by the trees that line the riverbank, decides to embark on a journey to explore the world above the water. Along the way, he meets a wise old owl who teaches him about the interconnectedness of all living things and the importance of appreciating the beauty in the world around us.

The Fish that Climbed Trees: A Musical Journey - This musical production tells the story of Finley's journey through a series of original songs that capture the emotions and themes of the story. From the upbeat and energetic "Riverbank Boogie" to the contemplative and introspective "Wonders Above," the music takes the audience on a journey of discovery and growth. The production features a talented cast of actors and musicians, and includes stunning visuals and choreography to bring the story to life.

The Fish that Climbed Trees: An Immersive Exhibition - This interactive exhibition brings the world of Finley and the story of the fish that climbed trees to life in a unique and immersive way. Visitors are transported to a fantastical underwater world, where they can interact with Finley and his friends, explore the riverbank, and discover the wonders of the natural world. The exhibition features stunning visuals, interactive exhibits, and hands-on activities that allow visitors to learn about the interconnectedness of all living things.

The Fish that Climbed Trees: A Virtual Reality Adventure - In this virtual reality experience, visitors are transported into the world of Finley and the fish that climbed trees. Using state-of-the-art VR technology, visitors can explore the riverbank and the world above it, interacting with Finley and his friends along the way. The experience is designed to be both educational and entertaining, teaching visitors about the importance of conservation and the interconnectedness of all living things.
